findings.reasoning: This function attempts to subtract 10 from a uint8 variable. If the value is too low, it will underflow and become a large positive number when treated as unsigned, leading to incorrect calculations in subsequent operations.

This function adds 10 to a uint8 variable. If the value is already at its maximum (255), adding 10 will cause an overflow into negative numbers when treated as signed, leading to incorrect calculations.

This function subtracts 10 from a uint8 variable. If the value is too low, it will underflow and become a large positive number when treated as unsigned, leading to incorrect calculations in subsequent operations.
This function adds a value to a uint8 variable. If the sum exceeds the maximum value for a uint8, it will overflow into negative numbers when treated as signed, leading to incorrect calculations.

This function adds a value to a uint8 variable. If the sum exceeds the maximum value for a uint8, it will overflow into negative numbers when treated as signed, leading to incorrect calculations.
